body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

 /kind bug


**What happened**:


pull-kubernetes-e2e-gce  and pull-kubernetes-kubemark-e2e-gce both start kube-apiserver with admission `PodPreset` and `Priority ` but without enabling priorityclasses and podpresets resources.

We can see many error logs from https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/62359/pull-kubernetes-e2e-gce/30086/artifacts/e2e-30086-4a1170-master/kube-apiserver.log
```
E0410 23:01:20.801667       1 reflector.go:205] pkg/client/informers/informers_generated/internalversion/factory.go:129: Failed to list *scheduling.PriorityClass: the server could not find the requested resource (get priorityclasses.scheduling.k8s.io)
E0410 23:01:20.803839       1 reflector.go:205] pkg/client/informers/informers_generated/internalversion/factory.go:129: Failed to list *settings.PodPreset: the server could not find the requested resource (get podpresets.settings.k8s.io)
```

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: e2e start kube-apiserver with admission-control PodPreset and  Priority but without api groups
